description:
Genius bartender, Sasakura Ryuu makes the most incredible cocktails anyone has ever tasted. Seeking his "Glass of God", individuals from all different walks of life visit his bar. With both a compassionate ear and a godly drink, Ryuu helps people with their problems.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Office Lady
tags.description: Prominently features a female office worker or OL.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

title.native: バーテンダー 神のグラス

node.description: Araki Joh is a manga artist mostly known for his work with Kenji Nagatomo on Bartender, and its sequels Bartender à Paris and Bartender à Tokyo. He has also written among others, Sommelier, along with Shinobu Kaitani, La Sommelière, with Katsunori Matsui, and Oui Chef!, with Hiyoko Kobayashi.
Formal member of the band 'Natural High'.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田繁美)

Founder and representative director of Atelier Musa.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/42231474)

The founder and representative director of [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/). Originally a producer for [Fuji TV](https://anilist.co/studio/169/), where he produced numerous anime for the Noitamina programming block.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田繁美)

Founder and representative director of Atelier Musa.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/康村諒)

Since 2012, he was president of [Seven Arcs](https://anilist.co/studio/35/Seven-Arcs) but retired from the company in March 2019.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/康村諒)

Since 2012, he was president of [Seven Arcs](https://anilist.co/studio/35/Seven-Arcs) but retired from the company in March 2019.
